1972
DEATH
Name: Harold S. Lumbatis
Source: newspaper clipping
Provided by Eloise Lumbatis January
Funeral Services for Harold S. Lumbatis, 72, of 313 Eastern Avenue, Woodsfield, were held Friday afternoon, at two oclock in the Michener Funeral Home, on Eastern Avenue, with Rev. George Bender officiating. Burial was in Friendship Cemetery, Lewisville.
Mr. Lumbatis died Tuesday morning, March 28, 1972, at 9:45 oclock in Marietta Memorial Hospital where he had been a patient since March 4th. He was born August 21, 1899, in Lewisville, a son of Steven and Catherine Thompson Lumbatis.
Mr. Lumbatis attended Ohio University and taught school in Monroe County. He retired last year as superintendent of the Monroe County Department of Highways. Mr. Lumbatis was a member of the United Methodist Church.
Surviving are his wife, Minnie Weber Lumbatis; one daughter, Mrs. Loren (Eloise) January, of Woodsfield, and three grandchildren.
Three brothers, Hallie, Earl, and George Lumbatis, preceded him in death
.
1972
Olive Jane (Stimpert) Frank, 79, died at 12:30 p.m. Wednesday February 9, 1972 at the home of a daughter, Mrs. William (Bonnie) Archer, 777 Rock Road, Zanesville.  She had been in ill health for four months.
          Born Oct. 23, 1892 in Lewisville, she was a daughter of Robert and Isabell Lafferre Stimpert.  She attended the Methodist Church.
          Surviving in addition to Mrs. Archer is another daughter, Mrs. Harry (Ava) Orr of Gratiot; four sons, Harold W. of Coopermill road, Elmer F. of Newport, Ore., Wilfred C. of 2495 Archer lane and Clarence L. of 1183 Hall avenue; five brothers, Clarence Stimpert, George Stimpert, Herman Stimpert all of Lewisville, Charles Stimpert of Utica and Burt Stimpert of 834 Walbash avenue; 27 grandchildren and 15 great-grandchildren
          Her husband, Herman, died in 1948.  Two sons and one brother are also deceased.
          Friends may call 7 to 9 p.m. Thursday and 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m.  Friday at the DeLong and Baker Funeral Home.

Birth
Name: Donda Lyn McKelvey
Source: The Monroe County Beacon
Issue: Woodsfield, Ohio, April 27, 1972
Mr. and Mrs. Donald McKelvey, of 313 Devon road, announce the birth of a daughter on Wednesday morning, April 19th, in Bellaire City Hospital. The new arrival weighed six pounds, two ounces, and has been named Donda Lyn. Mrs. McKelvey is the former Miss Linda Ackerman. The grandparents are Mr. and Mrs. Harold Ackerman, of East Marietta Street, Woodsfield, and Mr. and Mrs. Charles McKelvey, of Clarington, Ohio, Route 1. The great grandparents are Mr. and Mrs. Harry J. Winkler, of Sardis, Ohio, Route 2; Mrs. Lydia Reed, of Beallsville, Ohio, Route 3, and Mrs. Jessie Ackerman, of Woodsfield, Route 4. Donda Lyn has a brother, David, three years old.

1972
MARRIAGE
Names: Mr. Loren Rothacher
and Miss Connie Ackerman
Source: The Monroe County Beacon
Issue: Woodsfield, Ohio, July 6, 1972
Sunday, June eighteenth, in an open Church ceremony in St. Pauls United Church of Christ, Woodsfield, Miss Connie Ackerman and Mr. Loren Rothacher were united in marriage. Pastor Charles A. Price officiated at the double ring service at half after two oclock in the afternoon. Parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. William G. Ackerman, of Route 4, Woodsfield, and Mr. and Mrs. Clarence Rothacher, of Route 2, Sardis.
Mrs. Rothacher is a graduate of Woodsfield High School and Valley Beauty School, Marietta, Ohio. She is presently employed at Ritas Beauty Shop in Woodsfield. Mr. Rothacher is a graduate of River High School, Hannibal, Ohio and is a dairy farmer.
The couple will be residing on Route 2, Sardis, Ohio.

Edith Eaton. 1st wife of Gilbert F. Weber
Deaths
Mrs. Gilbert Weber, (Edith), 76, of Woodsville, July 27
[Source: The Times Recorder, Zanesville, Ohio, Friday, July 28, 1972, p. 1B]
 
Mrs. Gilbert Weber
Woodsfield-Mrs. Gilbert (Edith) Weber, 76, of South Main Street,
Woodsfield, died at 2:30 a.m. Thursday in Barnesville Hospital after a long
illness.
She was born August. 11, 1805, in Monroe County, daughter of George and
Effie Myers Eaton.
Mrs. Weber was a member of Holmes Chapter 371 of the Eastern Star at
Millersburg.
Surviving are her husband, Gilbert; a brother, Denzel Eaton of
Woodsfield and several nieces and nephews.
Friends may call after 7 p.m. today at Bauer and Turner Funeral Home
here where services will be held at 2 p.m. Sunday. Burial will be in Oak
Lawn Cemetery.
[Source: The Times Recorder, Zanesville, Ohio, Friday, July 28, 1972, p. 6A]

DEATH
Name: George W. Young
Source: The Times Recorder
Issue: Zanesville, Ohio, 1972
George W. Young, 77, of Miltonsburg, a retired automobile mechanic, died Saturday evening in Barnesville Hospital.
Born February 22, 1895, near Lewisville, he was the son of Michael and Molly Franks Young.
Mr. Young was a member of United Church of Christ and American Legion Post 87 at Woodsfield.
Survivors include his widow, Freda Landefeld Young; a daughter, Mrs. Joy Blowers of Cleveland; two grandchildren; a sister, Mrs. Ida Taylor of Miltonsburg; and a brother, Elmer Young of Cleveland.
Friends may call after 2 p.m. today at Bauer and Turner Funeral Home here where services will be held at 1 p.m. Tuesday conducted by Reverend Marshall Cook. Burial will be in Miltonsburg Cemetery.

Nov 1972
Herbert Edward Graham (proper name Herschel Edward Graham), son of Clarence
Graham and Gail Betts
Batesville Native Dies at Zanesville
Services for Herbert Edward Graham, 53, of Zanesville, were held
Tuesday at Zanesville with burial there. Mr. Graham died Friday at his
home. He had been ill since April.
Born at Batesville, May 2, 1918, he was the son of Clarence and Gail
Betts Graham. Most of his life was spent in the Zanesville area. He was a
World War II veteran.
Surviving are his widow, Elaine Trittipo Graham, four sons and a neth
Graham* of Zanesville and a sister, Mrs. Neva McKee of Phelan, Calif. Mrs.
Ernest Moore, Quaker City, is an aunt of the deceased.
[Source: shared by Evelena Brown; dated Nov. 2, 1972]
* typed as it appeared in the newspaper

Pearl Mae Schaub nee Geckler or Gheckler
The Canton Repository, 6 November 1972
MRS. PEARL M., age 82, the wife of Homer C. Schaub of 1891 Walnut St., SE, East Sparta, died Sunday [SUBMITTER'S NOTE: 5 November 1972] at Aultman Hospital, after a week's illness. Born in Bolivar and lived here 60 years. The Schaubs observed their 60th Wedding Anniversary October 12.  Besides her husband she is survived by one daughter: Mrs. Howard (Viola) Inboden of East Sparta. One grandson, Mac [SUBMITTER'S NOTE: should be Marc] Inboden. Two sisters: Mrs. Catherine Peterman and Mrs. Lucinda Miller both of Canton. One brother: Emmett Geckler of Strasburg. She was preceded in death by three sisters and four brothers. Services Wednesday at 1 p.m., Gordon Funeral Home, East Sparta. Rev. Earl Stock officating. Burial in Fort Laurens Cemetery, Boliver.
 
George W. Gildow
          George W. Gildow, 80, of Macksburg, Route 1, a retired tire builder and farmer, died Thursday afternoon, November 16, 1972, at three oclock, in Good Samaritan Medical Center, Zanesville, after an illness.  Born June 5, 1892, in Lower Salem, he was the son of Charles and Ella McPeek Gildow.  Mr. Gildow was formerly employed at Firestone Corporation.  He was a member of Lowell Grange 2475 and Lower Salem United Methodist Church.
          Surviving are his widow, Dorothy Wooster Gildow, whom he married December 23, 1916; a son, Eugene Gildow, of Providence, Rhode Island; a daughter, Mrs. Sarah Simon, of Struthers; two brothers, John Gildow of Lowell Route 1, and Hobart Gildow, of Daytona Beach, Florida; a sister, Mrs. Edna Williams, of Elba; five grandchildren and six great grandchildren.
